newsitem.title: UK: Market's EMU expectations edge lower - JP Morgan.
newsitem.headline: Market's EMU expectations edge lower - JP Morgan.

text.p: Market expectations of a broad-based European monetary union have edged lower in the past week with only Denmark showing a rise in the probability of participating along with expected core members, according to JP Morgan's EMU calculator.
In the past five trading days, market prices indicated that the perceived probability of Spain, Sweden and the UK joining EMU in 1999 all receded.
Spain fell 4.0 percentage points to 79 percent, Sweden 3.0 points to 73 percent and the UK, deemed the least likely to join EMU in 1999, was down 1.0 point to 41 percent.

The assigned probability of Italy joining was unchanged at 74 percent, while Denmark rose 4.0 points to 60 percent. The market still believes there is a 100 percent chance of France and Belgium joining in 1999, which was the same as last week, the calculator showed.
JP Morgan's EMU calculator derives from the interest rate swaps market probabilities of individual countries joining Germany in EMU in 1999.
The probabilities are derived from the actual swap spread, an in-house assumption of what the spread would be if EMU were not a factor, and the expected spread after EMU participation, which is zero.
